"If today...I will come to Bombay and make a film for every part of this country...it just can't be a Hindi film. It will be an Indian film," he added.

176.title: 'Operation Romeo' about moral policing experienced by all: Producer
176.article_body: 'Operation Romeo' producer Neeraj Pandey has stated that everyone has experienced moral policing of varying intensities at least once in their lives. "That's the reason we thought to make a film on it. The plot is intense and based on a specific incident," he added. It is helmed by Shashant Shah and features Bhumika Chawla, Sidhant Gupta and Sharad Kelkar.

177.title: To bowl with 'boom boom' Bumrah in nets has been special: MI's Meredith
177.article_body: MI pacer Riley Meredith said bowling in the nets with teammate Jasprit Bumrah has been "special" for him in IPL 2022. "At the moment, it's hard to get past the big 'boom boom' Bumrah...he's a great fellow and is more than happy to share some tricks with me," he added. Meredith hasn't featured in any match for MI so far.

178.title: Naga Babu's daughter among 144 detained at Hyd rave party, cocaine seized
178.article_body: Around 144 people, including actor Naga Babu Konidela's daughter and actress Niharika, were detained in a drugs raid at a rave party in an upscale pub in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills. Five packets of cocaine were found during the raid, police said. The winner of the third season of Bigg Boss Telugu Rahul Sipligunj and several politicians' children were also detained.

179.title: No Pakistani Prime Minister has ever completed a full 5-yr term in office
179.article_body: In Pakistan’s history, no Prime Minister has ever completed a full 5-year term in office. While the first PM Liaquat Ali Khan, was assassinated, others left due to the imposition of martial law or their governments getting dissolved. Notably, the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan was rejected and fresh elections will be held in 90 days.

180.title: Shia LaBeouf and partner Mia Goth welcome their first baby
180.article_body: Actor Shia LeBeouf and his partner model-actress Mia Goth have welcomed their first baby together. While they haven't made an official announcement, the couple was seen pushing a baby stroller in Los Angeles on Friday. Shia and Mia were previously married from 2016 to 2018 before separating amicably. They later rekindled their relationship and quarantined together during the COVID-19 lockdown.

181.title: My Insta account is probably hacked, beware of unusual activity: Yami
181.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, taking to Twitter on Sunday, has said that she has been unable to access her Instagram account. "It's probably hacked. We're trying to recover it as soon as possible," she added. "If there is any unusual activity through my account, please be aware of it," the actress further stated.

182.title: India to send 5 more aid consignments to Sri Lanka till May
182.article_body: India will send five more consignments of aid to Sri Lanka till May amid a severe economic crisis, Gopal Baglay, the Indian High Commissioner to the South Asian country, announced. Four consignments totaling over 1,50,000 tonnes of jet fuel, diesel and petrol have been delivered by India since March, he said. Currently, Sri Lanka has imposed a curfew.

183.title: Exorcist arrested for beating, scorching 14-yr-old in Jharkhand
183.article_body: An exorcist was arrested in Jharkhand's Chatra district for allegedly beating up a 14-year-old girl and scorching her with incense sticks to "ward off evil spirits," police said on Sunday. The girl had fallen sick after Holi and the accused assured her family that she would get better through exorcism, police said.

184.title: Videos of kangaroos roaming on West Bengal roads go viral; probe launched
184.article_body: Videos of kangaroos purportedly roaming on the roads of West Bengal have gone viral on social media. Responding to one of such videos, IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted, "They are part of smuggling." Divisional Forest Officer Hari Krishnan called the spottings "unusual", adding that a probe has been launched to investigate how and from where the animals reached nearby forests.

185.title: I'm partially to blame for centralising the internet: Twitter ex-CEO Dorsey
185.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey expressed his regrets for the current state of the internet and said, "I realise I'm partially to blame." Referring to earlier online communications systems, Dorsey tweeted, "The days of usenet, irc [Internet Relay Chat], the web...even email (w PGP)...were amazing. Centralising discovery and identity into corporations really damaged the internet."

186.title: Goa CM retains Home & Finance Depts as portfolios allocated in new Cabinet
186.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Sunday allocated portfolios to his eight Cabinet colleagues and retained the Home and Finance Ministries. Sawant also holds the Personnel and Vigilance portfolios. Rohan Khaunte, who joined BJP ahead of the state Assembly polls, will handle Tourism and Information Technology departments among others. Vishwajit Rane retained Health and Women and Child Development portfolios.

187.title: I'm not getting to go to the Grammys, I'm slammed this month: Miranda
187.article_body: Singer Miranda Lambert said she'll be missing the 64th Grammy Awards due to her hectic schedule following the release of her new album and upcoming tour. "I'm not getting to go again...I'm slammed this month, with the record coming out and everything," she stated. Lambert is nominated for Best Country Duo/Group Performance and Best Country Album in this year's Grammys.

188.title: FPIs withdraw ₹41,000 cr in Mar, become net sellers for 6th month
188.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹41,123 crore from the Indian equity market in March 2022. With this, FPIs became net sellers for the sixth consecutive month, having withdrawn net ₹1.48 lakh crore between October 2021 and March 2022. Apart from equities, the debt segment witnessed net outflows of ₹5,632 crore in March.

189.title: Unemployment rate dropping in India, fell to 7.6% in March: CMIE
189.article_body: India's unemployment rate is decreasing and fell to 7.6% in March 2022, the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy's (CMIE) data showed. The unemployment ratio further dropped to 7.5% on April 2, with urban unemployment at 8.5% and rural at 7.1%. Haryana recorded the highest unemployment rate in March at 26.7%, while Gujarat and Karnataka recorded the lowest at 1.8%.

190.title: CSK to bowl first against PBKS after winning their 1st toss in IPL 2022, playing XIs out
190.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja won his first toss in IPL 2022 and elected to bowl first against PBKS. CSK have made one change to their playing XI, with Chris Jordan replacing Tushar Deshpande. PBKS have made two changes to their playing XI, with Vaibhav Arora and Jitesh Sharma replacing Harpreet Brar and Raj Bawa.

191.title: Pune diesel prices rise to ₹100.60 per litre after 11th hike in 13 days
191.article_body: The diesel prices in Pune crossed the ₹100 per litre mark on Sunday after the 11th hike in prices in 13 days. The diesel in the city now costs ₹100.60 per litre, a rise of 83 paise from April 2, while petrol costs ₹117.87 per litre. The diesel price in Mumbai has been increased to ₹102.64 per litre from ₹101.79/litre.

192.title: Millionaire YouTuber Logan Paul wears most expensive Pokemon card at WWE debut
192.article_body: Millionaire YouTuber Logan Paul, who made his WWE WrestleMania debut recently, wore the world’s most expensive Pokemon card as a necklace. Paul wore a PSA Grade 10 Pikachu Illustrator card that he bought last year for $5,275,000 (around ₹40 crore). Paul's Pikachu card is one of the rarest Pokemon cards as only 39 of those exist in the world.

193.title: I've always wanted to represent India globally: Ranveer Singh
193.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has stated that he has always wanted to represent India globally. He added that as an actor he can represent the country and its universal themes with his work to millions of people across the world. "I find that humbling," Ranveer said. He further stated we are on the cusp of getting recognition on a global scale.

194.title: Didn't realise how good a player Moeen is until he joined CSK: Hussey
194.article_body: Speaking about Moeen Ali's batting, CSK batting coach Michael Hussey said the CSK all-rounder is an "unbelievable player and a beautiful batter". He added, "I only watched him closely for...first time when he joined CSK squad in the last season...I didn't realise [until then] how good a player he actually is." Moeen scored 35 runs off 22 balls against LSG.

195.title: We deserved a victory today: Lanning on Aus winning 2022 Women's WC
195.article_body: After Australia defeated England by 71 runs and won 2022 Women's World Cup title, Australia captain Meg Lanning said her side deserved the victory on Sunday. "We've been extremely consistent over a long period of time," she added. Australia didn't lose a single match in tournament, winning nine games on the trot. It is Australia's record-extending seventh World Cup title.

196.title: Delhi Police's IFSO unit arrests 8 for Chinese loan app fraud
196.article_body: Eight people were arrested by Delhi Police's Intelligence Fusion and Strategic Operations (IFSO) unit for abusing and extorting money from customers of a Chinese loan application. A complainant claimed that the abuse and extortion had taken place despite the repayment of the loan. The customers would receive threatening calls and text messages as part of the abuse, the police said.

197.title: Hyd Police arrests 3 people, seize gutka & tobacco worth over ₹17,500
197.article_body: Hyderabad Police apprehended three people on Friday and seized gutka and tobacco worth ₹17,579 from their possession. The accused, who had the materials in their possession in order to deliver them to customers at Mahadev Kirana & General Store, near Bowenpally check post, were nabbed by Bowenpally Police. They were caught based on a tip-off following a surprise check.

198.title: I like watching Rohit Sharma, he has aggressive nature: Odean
198.article_body: West Indies all-rounder Odean Smith has said that Rohit Sharma is the Indian player he admires the most. "Rohit is one of those players with (amazing) batting speed. He has a very aggressive nature and I would like to take that (aspect of his batting) in my game also," he stated. Odean further said, "I like watching him."

199.title: No penalty for not wearing face masks inside Delhi Metro
199.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on Sunday said no penalty will be imposed on passengers who are not wearing face masks while travelling in metro. "As per Delhi Disaster Management Authority guidelines, it is advised to follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviour like wearing of mask, hand sanitisation, etc," DMRC said in response to a query by a Twitter user.

200.title: Not keen on becoming UPA chief or leading anti-BJP front: Pawar
200.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar said on Sunday that he isn't keen on becoming United Progressive Alliance's (UPA) chairperson or leading anti-BJP front. Pawar, however, stated that he's supportive of the formation of such an alliance, adding that Congress should be included in it. Pawar's comments came after NCP's youth wing proposed his name for UPA chief's post.

201.title: New scheme plans to set up 'Hobby Hubs' in Delhi govt schools
201.article_body: The Directorate of Education (DoE) in Delhi plans to set up 'Hobby Hubs' in government schools for the 2022-2023 academic session, according to a report in The Indian Express. However, this project will only be implemented in single-shift government schools. The DoE will invite applications from interested academies to execute the project in schools, the report said.

202.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police educates students about road safety
202.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday conducted a road safety awareness drive in the town of Chevella. As per the force's official Twitter handle, Chevella Traffic Inspector G Guruvayya educated students about traffic rules at the Chevella bus stop. A group of students was told about the dangers and penalties for minor driving, rash driving and driving without a licence.

203.title: PCMC's building permission dept collects record ₹1,036-cr revenue in 2021-22
203.article_body: The building permission department of the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation generated a record ₹1,036 crore in revenue in the 2021-22 financial year. "The building permission department has never registered such a high collection in the past," Joint City Engineer Makrand Nikam said. Among other works, the department is responsible for issuing necessary permits for all kinds of buildings.

204.title: Mumbai man chats nude on dating app; blackmailed to pay ₹10,000
204.article_body: A 24-year-old from Mumbai's Andheri (East) was blackmailed to pay ₹10,000 via GPay after he chatted nude with a woman he met on a dating app. The victim joined a video call with the accused and removed his clothes upon seeing the girl nude. He later received a video saying it would be made viral if he doesn't pay ₹10,000.

205.title: Time running out, people must be protected: Sangakkara on Sri Lanka crisis
205.article_body: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Kumar Sangakkara took to Facebook to share his thoughts on the Sri Lankan economic crisis and emergency. "Sri Lankans are going through one of the toughest times imaginable," he wrote. "The people aren't the enemy, Sri Lanka is its people...Time is fast running out...the people and their future must be protected and provided for," he added.

206.title: Delhi Police arrests 110, recover 220 gms of ganja in last 24 hrs
206.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 110 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 220 grams of ganja in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 12 proclaimed offenders, seized 392 litres of illicit liquor and recovered 12 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,685 calls, the post added.

207.title: 17-yr-old kills father in Pune, hangs body to pass off as suicide
207.article_body: Pune Police on Saturday detained a 17-year-old boy for allegedly throttling his father to death and hanging his body on an iron pole outside their house to pass it off as a case of suicide. The boy allegedly killed his father because he suspected his mother's character and harassed her over this issue, the report said.

208.title: IFS officer posts pic of 'meditating owl', says 'it has the perfect camouflage'
208.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Susanta Nanda posted a picture of a 'meditating owl' on a tree and said, "[It] has the perfect camouflage that one can ever see." The picture quickly gained traction with many users trying to spot the camouflaged bird. "Even I had to meditate for a few seconds to make it visible," said one user.

209.title: Bharti Singh and Haarsh Limbachiyaa become parents, welcome a baby boy
209.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh and her producer-husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on Sunday took to social media to announce that they've become parents and welcomed a baby boy. The couple shared a picture of themselves that had "It's a boy" written on it. Earlier this week, Bharti Singh had refuted rumours that she had welcomed her first child, a baby girl.

210.title: MNS leader arrested for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers in Mumbai
210.article_body: MNS leader Mahendra Bhanushali was arrested on Sunday for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers without permission in Mumbai. "They have taken away my amplifier. But I would like to say, in coming times, 'Jai Shree Ram' will be played on loudspeakers," Bhanushali said following his arrest. Earlier, Hanuman Chalisa was played on loudspeakers at Maharashtra Navnirman Sena office in Ghatkopar.

211.title: Raj govt failed to maintain law & order: Shekhawat on Karauli clashes
211.article_body: Reacting to communal clashes in Rajasthan's Karauli on Saturday, Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said that state government has failed to maintain law and order. "If people are being attacked...for celebrating...Indian New Year in India...it's a matter of concern," he added. At least 25 people were left injured after clashes broke out following stone-pelting at a bike rally in Karauli.

212.title: Russian forces preventing Ukrainian resupply by Black Sea: UK
212.article_body: UK Military Intelligence on Sunday said Russia naval forces continue to blockade the Ukrainian coast on the Black Sea and Sea of Azov, preventing resupply by sea. As per the update, Russian forces retain the ability to launch an amphibious landing. However, it said  mines within the Black Sea pose a serious risk to maritime activity.

213.title: I'm greedy actor, want to tell stories irrespective of medium: Vidya
213.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has called herself a greedy actor, saying that she just wants to tell stories and connect to people irrespective of any medium. She further said that she doesn't have any method to choose a script and picks them instinctively. "We are in a day and age where some films will work and some won't," the actress added.

214.title: BTS' Jungkook recovers from COVID-19, to perform at Grammys
214.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS member Jungkook has recovered from COVID-19 and will be performing at the 2022 Grammys ceremony in US' Las Vegas, his management agency announced on Sunday. The singer had tested negative for COVID-19 before departing from South Korea but tested positive after landing in US. Jungkook has been under quarantine since March 27.

215.title: You need confidence after losing 1st match: Babar on ODI series win vs Aus
215.article_body: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam has credited his players for the 2-1 ODI series win against Australia. "You need confidence after losing the first game. Credit goes to the players as they took responsibility and showed good efforts," Azam said. He adds, "When you get early wickets, there is pressure on the opposition. Almost every bowler of ours executed their plans."

216.title: Ozone may be weakening one of Earth's vital cooling mechanisms: Study
216.article_body: A group of international researchers warned ozone may be weakening one of Earth's most important cooling mechanisms. The study revealed that ozone levels in upper and lower atmosphere were responsible for almost a third of the warming in the Southern Ocean. Team used models to simulate changes in ozone levels in the upper and lower atmosphere between 1955 and 2000.

217.title: Poland would like a 50% increase in US troops in Europe: Deputy PM
217.article_body: Polish Deputy PM Jaroslaw Kaczynski on Sunday said Poland would be pleased if US increased its number of troops by 50% in Europe. "Of these, 75,000 soldiers should be stationed on the eastern flank, 50,000 soldiers in the Baltic states, Poland," the leader of the ruling party added. Reportedly, 80,000 US troops were stationed in Europe before Russians entered Ukraine.

218.title: Our team sets out to win events like World Cup: Alyssa Healy
218.article_body: After winning their seventh Women's World Cup, Australian wicketkeeper-batter Alyssa Healy said that her team "sets out to win events like these (World Cup)". "Everyone is sort of keen to get out there and do just that," Healy said. She also said that she "never imagined in her wildest dreams" of scoring 170 in the World Cup final against England.

219.title: UN Human Rights Council names Tuvalu negotiator as climate expert
219.article_body: UN Human Rights Council on Friday appointed Tuvalu negotiator Ian Fry an expert on climate change and human rights for first time on Friday. The new independent expert is required to study and identify how the adverse effects of climate change affect the full and effective enjoyment of human rights. Fry has been appointed for a period of three years.

220.title: Fire breaks out at Kanpur's Rave Moti Mall, no injury reported
220.article_body: A fire broke out at Kanpur's Rave Moti Mall, where a huge number of people had come, on Sunday. No injury was reported so far, Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Brijesh Srivastava said, adding six fire tenders were on spot. The fire on first floor was under control and efforts were underway to douse the flames on second floor.

221.title: India's exports touch record high of $417.8 bn in FY22, govt calls it 'historic'
221.article_body: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday announced that India's exports touched a record high of $417.8 billion in FY22, and called the milestone "historic". "It's the first time that the country's yearly exports have reached this figure and the exports were 5% above the set target," Goyal said. Goods worth $40 billion were exported in March 2022 alone.

222.title: You don't know which Punjab will turn up: Parthiv ahead of PBKS vs CSK
222.article_body: Ahead of PBKS-CSK in IPL 2022, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said PBKS are playing the same way despite having overhauled the set-up. "You don't know which Punjab will turn up- the 200-run...or 120-run Punjab because such is the style of play," he added. PBKS have played two matches so far, winning and losing one each. Match will be played today.

223.title: Congratulations for yet another WC: Jaffer after Aus Women's 7th title
223.article_body: Following Australia's record-extending seventh Women's World Cup title in Christchurch, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations to Australia Women for winning yet another World Cup...commiserations to England." Australia Test captain Pat Cummins tweeted, "Congratulations to Meg [Lanning], Motty [Matthew Mott] and the team. Huge. What a win and tournament, enjoy accordingly."

224.title: Mumbai Police band plays 'Happy B'day' for kid amid 'Sunday Streets'
224.article_body: A team from Khaki Studio, the Mumbai Police's band, which was present during the 'Sunday Streets' event in the city, was seen playing the 'Happy Birthday' tune for a child celebrating his birthday amid the gathering. In a video uploaded on Instagram, the child can be seen cutting his birthday cake while the tune is played by the band.

225.title: I am exhausted: Singer Camila on being stalked by photographers for bikini pics
225.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello took to Instagram to share a post on her body image struggles and how photographers stalk her to get her bikini pictures when she goes to the beach. Adding that she is exhausted, Camila said that photographers even hide in the bushes sometimes to get pictures. She further said it has impacted her self esteem.

226.title: People not having kids in the first place is a problem: Elon Musk
226.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who has raised concerns about the falling birth rate in the past, on Sunday tweeted, "Humanity did not evolve to mourn the unborn...But we should...I'm talking about not having kids in the first place. That's the problem." He also responded to a picture of Nikola Tesla by tweeting, "He never had even one kid."

227.title: Russian troops selling items looted from Ukraine in Belarus: Ukraine ministry
227.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry has shared a social media post on how Russian troops have opened a market in Belarus to sell goods stolen from houses in Ukraine during the invasion. The ministry said they have been selling washing machines, children's toys, cosmetics, cars, dishes and jewellery, among other things. They are also trying to exchange looted currency, it added.

228.title: Over 600 arrested in Sri Lanka's Western Province for violating curfew
228.article_body: Sri Lanka on Sunday arrested 664 protesters in the country's Western Province for violating a 36-hour-long curfew that has been imposed amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. The arrests were made ahead of planned 'Arab Spring' style protests across country, which were held later today. Sri Lanka is grappling with a shortage of essential items and rolling power cuts.

229.title: Would've been nice had I stayed to finish the game vs RR: MI's Tilak
229.article_body: Mumbai Indians batter Tilak Varma, reacting to his knock against Rajasthan Royals, said, "I'm very happy to know...I have become the youngest MI player to score a fifty." Despite Tilak's 33-ball 61 runs, Rajasthan defeated Mumbai by 23 runs. "It would've been nice had I stayed to finish the game. I'll try to do so in upcoming matches," he added.

230.title: India beat England 3-2 on penalties in FIH Pro League game
230.article_body: India defeated England 3-2 in penalty shoot-out after the English team scored an equaliser with just 12 seconds remaining in the FIH Men's Hockey Pro League match in Bhubaneswar on Saturday. Both teams finished at 3-3 leading to the shoot-outs which India won in their seventh shoot-out attempt. Defender Harmanpreet Singh was adjudged as the 'Player of the Match'.

231.title: I'm mature player now: Imam-Ul-Haq after ODI series win vs Australia
231.article_body: After scoring unbeaten 89 runs in a nine-wicket win over Australia in the third ODI, Pakistan batter Imam-Ul-Haq said, "I'm a mature player now. Working hard from last one and a half years." Talking about winning the ODI series, he said, "The way boys came back from the first match comes down to the self-belief...trust we have in each other."

232.title: BMC to set up solar-powered poles in Mumbai to save electricity
232.article_body: BMC will set up solar power electric poles resembling trees in Mumbai as part of its tactical urbanism plan. Each pole will have five high-power LED lights and "will be able to save up to 35% of daily consumption of regular electricity", according to officials. "The primary objective is...to spread awareness about...clean and renewable energy," the project in-charge said.

233.title: Praggnanandhaa can become future world champion: Viswanathan Anand
233.article_body: Five-time world champion Viswanathan Anand said he feels that 16-year-old chess Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa can become a "world champion" in the future. "It's a big deal to beat... Magnus Carlsen. Praggnanandhaa has done it, so he has got talent," Anand said. "I am working with some young talents including Praggnanandhaa...All have the potential...[to] become World Champions," he added.

234.title: RS played crucial role in strengthening parliamentary democracy: Naidu
234.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday said that the Rajya Sabha has played a "crucial role in strengthening parliamentary democracy". "I would like to appeal to the members of Rajya Sabha to engage in informed and constructive debates by keeping the welfare of the people in mind," the Vice President said.

235.title: Argument over WhatsApp chat claims man's life in Kerala
235.article_body: An argument while chatting on WhatsApp led to a 42-year-old man getting killed in Kerala’s Pathanamthitta district on Saturday. According to the police, the deceased, Ranjith, was a newspaper agent who got into a scuffle with his neighbour Anil (43) on March 27 over a WhatsApp conversation. During the brawl, Ranjith suffered a fatal head injury, police said.

236.title: Video shows rescue of woman smuggled in duffel bag from a burning car in US
236.article_body: A video has been shared by the police in the US which captured the moment when a woman, who was stuffed in a duffel bag, was rescued from a burning car. While the bodycam footage captured how the woman was rescued, it's believed that she was being smuggled by a man who crashed the car, resulting in it catching fire.

237.title: Can't please everybody, not an avocado: Malaika on fashion choices
237.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora, on being asked about her fashion choices, said that she can't please everybody, adding that she is not an avocado. "When I was younger I was far more experimental and some of those experiments turned out terrible," she added. The actress gave the interview hours before getting hospitalised following a car accident on Saturday.

238.title: Man arrested for raping 16-yr-old disabled girl in Delhi
238.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly raping a 16-year-old disabled girl in Delhi, officials said on Sunday. "A PCR call was received around 8.45 am on Saturday at Mahendra Park Police Station, stating that a teenage girl has been raped in the area, following which the police rushed to the spot," an official said.

239.title: Saddened by the way Delhi bungalow was vacated: Chirag Paswan
239.article_body: LJP leader Chirag Paswan said he was saddened by the way the government bungalow in Delhi allotted to his father late Ram Vilas Paswan was vacated. "I never said that I want 12, Janpath forever. My family respects the law," Chirag Paswan said. "We were ready to vacate the house but why were we humiliated like this?" Paswan added.

240.title: Pak's Punjab Assembly adjourned without voting to elect new CM
240.article_body: A session of Pakistan's Punjab Assembly was adjourned till April 6 on Sunday without voting to elect the new Chief Minister. PML-Q's Chaudhry Parvez Elahi, one of the contenders for the CM's post, claimed the session was adjourned following an "attack" by the opposition lawmakers on MPAs of the ruling party. This comes amid a political crisis in Pakistan.

241.title: Shanghai asks 26 mn citizens to self-test for COVID as China sees highest cases in 2 yrs
241.article_body: Shanghai has ordered its 26 million residents to undergo two more rounds of tests for COVID-19. Residents should self-test on Sunday using antigen kits and report any positive results, while a nucleic acid test would be conducted on Monday. China on Sunday reported over 13,000 new COVID-19 cases, the highest since the peak of the first wave in February 2020.

242.title: Vicky remembers Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw on his birth anniversary
242.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to his Instagram Stories on Sunday to remember Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw on his 108th birth anniversary. He shared a picture of the Field Marshal, who's popularly known as 'Sam Bahadur'. "Remembering Sam Bahadur," he wrote, with some folded hands emojis. Vicky will play Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw in an upcoming biopic, titled 'Sam Bahadur'.

243.title: Economic jihad by K'taka CM will ensure we don't get jobs: Cong MLA
243.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Priyank Kharge said "economic jihad" by CM Basavaraj Bommai's party "will ensure that we neither get investments [nor] jobs". This comes after Bengaluru-based Khatabook Founder Ravish Naresh said the city's HSR/Koramangala area has bad roads and poor quality water supply. Telangana Minister KTR Rao later replied to Naresh's tweet and asked him to move to Hyderabad.

244.title: Gauri Khan share pics with Farah, says 'Never a dull moment with her'
244.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's wife, interior designer Gauri Khan shared few pictures with choreographer-director Farah Khan on Instagram. One of the pictures, showed Farah holding Gauri from behind. Praising Farah, Gauri captioned the post, "Never a dull moment hanging with Farah...Love her cinema and her humour." According to reports, Farah and Gauri have collaborated for a new show.

245.title: It was the biggest blockbuster of 1992: Anil celebrates 30 yrs of 'Beta'
245.article_body: Anil Kapoor on Sunday shared a post on Instagram marking the 30th anniversary of his film 'Beta'. He shared a series of photos, where he and Madhuri Dixit were seen receiving an award for the movie. "It was a great feeling for us as actors when our film was the biggest blockbuster of...1992 and received so much love," Anil wrote.

246.title: Malaika returns to home from hospital after suffering injuries in car accident
246.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora has returned to her Mumbai home after suffering injuries in a car accident on the Mumbai-Pune highway on Saturday. The actress was discharged from the hospital on Sunday morning. "The actress suffered minor injuries on her forehead; CT scan has turned out fine & she is currently okay," Apollo Hospital had said on Saturday night.

247.title: Man who said he accidentally kissed woman in Mumbai train jailed for 1 year
247.article_body: A man from Goa was sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment after being found guilty of kissing a woman on her cheek on a Mumbai local train in 2015. The man claimed his lips inadvertently touched her cheek after he was pushed by a commuter and fell on her. The court rejected his defence, saying women are "perceptive" about such things.

248.title: Those involved in rioting won't be spared: Rajasthan CM on Karauli incident
248.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has assured strict action against those responsible for communal clashes that broke out in Karauli on Saturday. "Those involved in inciting riots will not be spared and stringent action will be taken against them. Rule of law will be followed in the state," Gehlot added. Section 144 was imposed in the area following the incident.

249.title: Left Kashmir due to extremism, will go back as Bharat Bhakt: RSS chief
249.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that Kashmiri Pandits left the valley due to extremism. "But when we'll return now...we'll go back as Hindus & 'Bharat Bhakt' with...an assurance of our security and livelihood. We'll live in way...that nobody will dare to displace us," he said, adding, "Kashmiri Pandits [are] bearing brunt of getting displaced from...home in...own country for...last 3-4 decades."

250.title: SDM booked after clerk beaten to death in UP’s Pratapgarh
250.article_body: The sub-divisional magistrate (SDM) of Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh, Gyanendra Vikram Singh, has been booked in connection with the death of a tehsil clerk. The family of the 57-year-old victim, Sunil Kumar Sharma, has alleged that he died after being severely beaten up by Singh and a few others. The case was registered against the SDM after the government employees protested.

251.title: Late rapper Tupac's love letters to girl named Cosima sold at auction for over $50,000
251.article_body: Late rapper Tupac Shakur's love letters to a girl named Cosima have been sold at an auction for over $50,000. Tupac and Cosima had met in October 1988, when the rapper was 17 years old. All of the letters, written in 1988-1999 were signed at the end with "Thinking of U! Eternally your friend, Tupac A Shakur".

252.title: Ensure animals are stunned before slaughtering them in B'luru: K'taka govt
252.article_body: The Karnataka Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Services Department has asked the Bengaluru civic body to ensure animals are mandatorily stunned before they are slaughtered for meat. The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has also been asked to check the stunning facility while issuing licences for slaughterhouses and chicken shops. The directions come amid the 'halal' meat controversy.

253.title: I'm gay, thought I'd never ever come out: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael
253.article_body: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael has come out in his comedy special 'Rothaniel', saying, "I had a secret...I kept from my...family...friends... Professionally, personally. And that secret is that I'm gay." Jerrod further said he rebelled against it his whole life and thought he'd "never ever come out". "At many points I thought I'd rather die than...actually say it to people," he added.

254.title: Varun Sood, Divya Agarwal spotted for the first time post breakup, pics surface
254.article_body: Divya Agarwal and Varun Sood were spotted in the city together for the first time post their breakup. The former couple was seen together at a footwear sale event which also had a live DJ set at night. Several pictures surfaced online, where Varun is seen protecting Divya from the crowd as they made their way to the event.

255.title: Bowling partners make things easy for me: GT pacer Lockie Ferguson
255.article_body: After picking up four wickets against Delhi Capitals on Saturday, Gujarat Titans pacer Lockie Ferguson said that his "bowling partners make things very easy" for him. "It's great (to have a potent bowling unit) and helps to spread calmness in the group. The pressure was coming from both ends with the ball and it worked for us," Ferguson said.

256.title: Will hold 5-pronged protest against Centre over paddy procurement: TRS Min
256.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi Minister KT Rama Rao has said that his party is going to hold a five-pronged protest against the BJP-led Centre across Telangana over the ongoing paddy procurement issue in the state. Different forms of protests including the blocking of national highways will take place on April 4, 6, 7, 8 and 11, Rao said.

257.title: Getting married didn't matter for me; Siddharth changed my perspective: Vidya
257.article_body: Vidya Balan has revealed that earlier she felt being in a live-in relationship or marriage didn't matter.  She added that now she appreciates marriage because of her husband Siddharth Roy Kapur and he changed her perspective. "I feel blessed to have him as my partner. He accepts me the way I'm, on my good days and bad days," Vidya said.

258.title: Over 90% people satisfied with Mohalla clinics: Delhi govt survey
258.article_body: Around 93% of the patients that visit the Aam Aadmi Mohalla clinics in Delhi are satisfied with its services, according to a Delhi government survey. A patient spends an average of 9.92 minutes to meet the doctor and 8.35 minutes to collect medicines at the clinic. Around 116 patient visits were recorded per Mohalla clinic per day in 2021.

259.title: Maharashtra Police make monkey drink water from bottle, video surfaces
259.article_body: Maharashtra Police made a monkey drink water from a bottle. The video of the incident went viral on social media. "Salute to Maharashtra Police for the kindness and compassion towards voiceless babies," an Instagram user wrote while sharing the video. Several users dropped hearts in the comments section of the video.

260.title: Rachakonda Police share QR code for recruitment training enrolment
260.article_body: Hyderabad’s Rachakonda Police have shared a QR code on Twitter for aspirants seeking pre-recruitment training to enrol in police. Eligible aspirants residing within Rachakonda limits, who wish to apply for Telangana Police jobs, including roles of sub-inspector and police constable, can scan code and apply for free integrated coaching, police said. The last date to apply is April 5.

261.title: Sri Lankan Navy apprehends 12 Indian fishermen, impounds boat near Delft island
261.article_body: The Sri Lankan Navy on Sunday apprehended 12 Indian fishermen and impounded one boat for allegedly fishing near Delft island. The fishermen had gone out to sea in 530 mechanised boats on Saturday. This comes amid an economic crisis in the neighbouring country, due to which the Sri Lankan Navy has increased patrolling activities to avoid its nationals from escaping.

262.title: Shooting next film in Iran, will take mom along: John Abraham
262.article_body: Actor John Abraham has stated that he'll be shooting his next film 'Tehran' in Iran, adding he would probably be the first Indian actor to shoot there. "My mom has got 21 cousins in Iran and I want to take her along," he said. John added that 'Tehran' is in the geopolitical space of 'Madras Cafe', 'Batla House' and 'Parmanu'.

263.title: Nepal becomes 4th country to launch India's e-payment system RuPay
263.article_body: Nepal on Saturday became the fourth country in the world to operationalise India's e-payment system RuPay. The three other countries that have the RuPay card are Bhutan, Singapore and the United Arab Emirates. The Indian External Affairs Ministry said the launch of the card in Nepal would open new vistas for cooperation in financial connectivity and further strengthen people-to-people linkages.

264.title: Delhi-Meerut rail corridor to be designed to handle medical emergencies
264.article_body: The stations and train coaches of the rapid rail corridor between Delhi, Ghaziabad and Meerut will be designed to handle health emergencies. "Lifts will be big enough to accommodate stretchers, wheelchairs and people, like in hospitals...in rapid rail any person can reach Delhi-NCR's big hospitals...in 55 minutes without traffic...or extra charges usually spent on ambulances," an official said.

265.title: Newlyweds, friend drown in river while clicking selfies in Maha
265.article_body: A newly married couple and their friend drowned as they were allegedly clicking selfies in a village in Maharashtra's Beed, police said on Sunday. "The trio drowned while trying to save each other," an official said. The three deceased's bodies had been fished out of the river a day earlier, the official added. Three accidental death reports have been filed.

266.title: After Raj's remark, Hanuman Chalisa played on Mumbai loudspeakers
266.article_body: A day after MNS chief Raj Thackeray demanded removal of loudspeakers in mosques, Hanuman Chalisa was played on loudspeakers at the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena office in Mumbai's Ghatkopar. "I am warning now...Remove loudspeakers or else will put loudspeakers in front of the mosque and play Hanuman Chalisa," Thackeray had said.

267.title: Talk of stagflation in India is 'overhyped': NITI Aayog VC
267.article_body: India is on the cusp of a major economic recovery and talks of possible stagflation are "overhyped", said NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar. "I am sure that the RBI is well in control of [inflation] and will take necessary steps if and when required," Kumar said. Despite the Russia-Ukraine war, "India will remain the fastest growing economy", he added.

268.title: Pune Police busts an IPL betting racket, seize ₹27 lakh, 8 phones
268.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police have arrested three people after busting an IPL betting racket at Kalewadi on Saturday night. The police seized ₹27 lakh and eight cell phones from the accused, who were betting on the match between Delhi Capitals and Gujarat Titans, which was being played at the MCA stadium in Pune.

269.title: Drug cultivation banned in world's biggest opium producer Afghanistan by Taliban
269.article_body: The Taliban has banned the cultivation of narcotics in Afghanistan, the world's biggest opium producer. The authorities said that if anyone violated the decree, the crop will be destroyed immediately and the violator will be treated according to Sharia law. Apart from this, the production, use or transportation of other narcotics has also been banned.

270.title: My wedding should be drama-free; there's enough drama in my work life: Taapsee
270.article_body: Taapsee Pannu said that she wants a "single-day wedding affair" in tasteful nude and other subtle colours. She added, "It needs to be basic and drama-free because there's enough drama in my professional life, and I don't want it to trickle down into my personal life." Taapsee further said that she doesn't want any late night rites at her wedding.

271.title: Not bowling Moeen in 19th over was a mistake: Kaif on CSK's loss vs LSG
271.article_body: Following CSK's six-wicket loss against LSG in IPL 2022, Mohammad Kaif said not giving 19th over to Moeen Ali was a mistake, adding it wasn't skipper Ravindra Jadeja's decision. "He [Jadeja] is still learning. Even now, decisions are taken by MS Dhoni," he added. With 34 runs needed off last 12 balls, Shivam Dube conceded 25 runs in 19th over.

272.title: Good thing that Hardik took the new ball with Shami vs DC: Jaffer
272.article_body: Ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer said he was "very impressed" with Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya's bowling during the match against Delhi Capitals in the IPL 2022. "The pace was up...he was touching 140 [kmph]...[it was a] good thing...he took the new ball with (Mohammad) Shami," Jaffer added. Hardik conceded 22 runs in his bowling spell and scalped one wicket.

273.title: Delhi Capitals need to improve batting in powerplay: Ricky Ponting
273.article_body: Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting said his team needs to improve the batting performance during the powerplay. "If you are losing three wickets in the powerplay, it's really hard to win games from there...That's certainly one area that we got to get better at, getting through that powerplay," he added. Gujarat Titans defeated Delhi Capitals by 14 runs.

274.title: Ambulance with patient runs out of fuel in UP, dragged to fuel station
274.article_body: An ambulance that was on its way with a patient to Uttar Pradesh's Meerut allegedly ran out of fuel mid-way. A tractor then dragged the ambulance to the nearest fuel station. Chief Medical Officer of Meerut Dr Akhilesh Mohan said that the ambulance was not from Meerut and was coming from Bijnor when the incident took place.

275.title: MP CM asks hotel owners in Ujjain to use Hindi signboards instead of English
275.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has asked hotel owners in Ujjain, an ancient city, to use Hindi signboards instead of English. "Our academic development will happen only with the growth of our language," he said. Chouhan added that the practice of begging on Ujjain's streets should be stopped and a mass feast should be held regularly for the poor.

276.title: Grammys 2022 to have special segment dedicated to Ukraine
276.article_body: The 64th Grammy Awards will have a special segment dedicated to Ukraine's ongoing crisis amid the war with Russia. "We're heartbroken by...situation in Ukraine, yet still moved by the resilient spirit on display there every day," Recording Academy CEO Harvey Mason Jr said, adding, "We hope the segment inspires our audience to get involved to support critical humanitarian efforts."

277.title: Ex-UN prosecutor calls for global arrest warrant against Putin
277.article_body: A former prosecutor of UN war crimes tribunals, Carla Del Ponte, has called for a global arrest warrant for Russian President Vladimir Putin over the war in Ukraine. "Putin is a war criminal," she said. "These dead people have loved ones who don't even know what's become of them. That is unacceptable," she said of mass graves in Ukraine.

278.title: Law of land prevails in Maharashtra: Sanjay Raut on Raj Thackeray’s remark
278.article_body: The law of the land prevails in Maharashtra and the state Home Minister will do everything as per the law, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said on Sunday. His statement came in reaction to MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s comment to remove the loudspeakers from mosques. "People thought it (Raj Thackeray's event) was BJP's event," Raut added.

279.title: Indore zoo arranges ACs, water coolers for animals amid rising temperatures
279.article_body: In view of the rising temperatures, arrangements have been made for coolers, ACs and sprinklers at Indore’s Kamla Nehru Zoological Garden to provide respite to animals from the heat. "The water bodies and coolers have been installed for tiger, lion, leopard…Piped water is also being sprayed," Zoo in-charge, Dr Uttam Yadav, said.

280.title: US makes 40 miles per gallon mileage must for new vehicles by 2026
280.article_body: By 2026, all new vehicles sold in the US must deliver a mileage of at least 49 miles per gallon, the government has ordered. Currently, the minimum mileage required for vehicles stands at 28 mpg. The administration said the new rules are the strongest to date, which will save over 220 billion gallons of gasoline over the lives of vehicles.

281.title: Saisha Shinde returns to 'Lock Upp' after apology to Kangana
281.article_body: Designer Saisha Shinde, who was eliminated from reality show 'Lock Upp' following an argument with host Kangana Ranaut, has returned to the show. A promo shows her reentering the jail while dancing to the song 'Bole Chudiyan Bole Kangana'. This comes after Saisha took to Instagram to apologise to Kangana saying she just wanted to be a version of her.

282.title: Russian airstrikes hit 'critical infrastructure' near Odessa port
282.article_body: The Russian military on Sunday carried out strikes on "critical infrastructure" near Ukraine's Odessa. An oil processing plant and fuel depots around the strategic Black Sea port were targeted in the attack. A Russian Defense Ministry spokesman said Russian ships and aircraft fired missiles on Sunday to strike the facilities that were used to provide fuel to Ukrainian troops.

283.title: Nice 'take your husband to work day' for Healy: Jaffer on Starc cheering for her
283.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share picture of Mitchell Starc cheering for his wife and fellow cricketer Alyssa Healy in Australia's 2022 Women's World Cup final against England. Starc was seen giving Healy a standing ovation after she reached the three-figure mark. "Pretty nice 'take your husband to work day' for Healy," wrote Jaffer.

284.title: 'Adipurush' will depict 'Parakrama' side of Lord Ram: Director Om Raut
284.article_body: Director Om Raut spoke about his upcoming film 'Adipurush',  an adaptation of 'Ramayana', and said, "Ramayana has always had a strong influence since ages. I'm depicting the 'Parakrama' (splendour and magnificence) side of Ram." He added that shooting with Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan has been a great experience. 'Adipurush' will feature Prabhas as Lord Ram and Saif as Ravan.

285.title: Ex-Bengaluru Police chief Bhaskar Rao quits, likely to join AAP
285.article_body: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao's resignation has been accepted by the  Karnataka government. Rao, who was presently serving as the Additional Director General of Police, is likely to join the AAP on Monday. The 1990-batch IPS officer had cited personal reasons for the resignation. He was the city police chief between 2019 and 2020.

286.title: WHO suspends UN supply of Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine
286.article_body: The WHO has suspended the supply through United Nations agencies of Covaxin, the COVID-19 vaccine produced by India's Bharat Biotech. Reuters and Bloomberg reported that the suspension is to allow the manufacturer to upgrade facilities and address deficiencies found in an inspection. "The WHO said the vaccine is effective and no safety concerns exist," the reports added.

287.title: Putin using body double to avoid being assassinated amid Ukraine war: Report
287.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is reportedly using a body double to foil any assassination attempts amid the ongoing invasion of Ukraine. As per a report, his body double has also been trained to walk in the same manner as Putin and is also present at Kremlin meetings. He is also said to be living in the same Presidential complex.

288.title: I like Tilak Varma's temperament, he isn't scared of big names: Shastri
288.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has praised MI's 19-year-old batter Tilak Varma after he scored 61 off 33 balls against RR in their match on Saturday. "I like Tilak's temperament very much. He wasn't scared of the big names...He used the pace really well too. This is a good omen for MI," stated Shastri. Tilak had scored 22(15) against DC.

289.title: Demi Lovato gets a tattoo to show support for Ukrainian refugees
289.article_body: Singer Demi Lovato has got a new tattoo to show her support for refugees around the world, including those fleeing Ukraine. The tattoo on her arm says "choose love", which is also the name of a non-profit organisation that supports refugees. Tattoo artist Gusak, whose home country is Ukraine, made the tattoo for Lovato.

290.title: Lunch box came with salad, he'd say 'What's this, where's food?': Juhi on Rishi
290.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla recalled that during 'Luck By Chance', late actor Rishi Kapoor's lunch box came with sprouts and salads. "He said, 'What is this, where is my food?'" Juhi said, adding, "That was Chintuji." Meanwhile, 'Sharmaji Namkeen' producer Ritesh Sidhwani said that Kapoor looked forward to his lunch breaks and his night meals.

291.title: 280 people buried in mass grave in Ukraine's Bucha: Mayor
291.article_body: Mayor of Ukraine's Bucha has said that about 280 people have been buried in a mass grave after Russian troops retreated. According to a Reuters report, the mayor added that "a mass grave at one church...was still open, with hands and feet poking through red clay heaped on top". Earlier, a video showing bodies on Bucha's streets had surfaced online.

292.title: Herd of elephants looking for 'mahua' liquor destroys houses in Chhattisgarh
292.article_body: A herd of more than a dozen elephants on Saturday allegedly destroyed several houses in Chhattisgarh's Surguja. "As a measure of safety, we have been leaving our homes every evening and returning in the morning," a local resident said. "The elephants are attracted to 'mahua' [liquor] stored in the houses, for which they have destroyed them," Surguja DFO said.

293.title: Trying to get back my 'Force' body; want to break through walls: John
293.article_body: John Abraham said he's trying to get back to his 'Force' body, where he can just break through the walls. When asked about 'Force 3', John said, "Force is the most untapped action franchise right now. I want to make 'Force' into a tentpole summer blockbuster." "It has the potential of being one of the biggest action franchises," he added.

294.title: Dravid will do a remarkable job as India head coach: Ganguly
294.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said Rahul Dravid will do a remarkable job as India head coach as he's honest. "He's as meticulous...professional as he was during his playing days," he added. Ganguly further said that Dravid will make mistakes as everybody does but he can become successful by doing right things. Dravid was appointed as head coach in November 2021.

295.title: Kalyan-Kasara train services hit after rail fracture; restored later
295.article_body: Local train services on the Kalyan-Kasara route of the Central Railway in Thane were affected for around an hour on Sunday morning due to a rail fracture. The issue was reported at 10.40 am between Umbermali and Kasara. It was resolved by 11.30 am and the local train services resumed later.

296.title: 43 'chulhas' in kitchen of Puri's Jagannath Temple found vandalised
296.article_body: At least 43 'chulhas' (stoves) in the kitchen of Puri's Jagannath Temple were found vandalised on Sunday, officials said. "We are not sure who did it, but the servitors who are responsible would face disciplinary action," a temple official said. Officials said around six to eight servitors who are engaged in the cooking rituals were possibly involved in the incident.

297.title: IPL betting racket busted in Noida, 6 arrested
297.article_body: The police on Saturday busted an IPL betting racket operating in Noida, arresting six people in the process, according to officials. The police seized ₹1.64 lakh in cash, 12 cellphones, 20 bank passbooks and two vehicles from the suspects. Nearly 50 to 60 people used to bet on the matches daily, a senior official said.

298.title: Pak elections to be held in 90 days after no-trust motion against Imran Khan rejected
298.article_body: Pakistan's Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting Farrukh Habib said that new elections will be held in 90 days. This comes after PM Imran Khan called for fresh elections and for the Assemblies to be dissolved after the no-trust motion against him was rejected. Habib added that PM Khan will continue his duties under Article 224 of the Constitution.

299.title: Women don't ask for pics: Yashpal on the drawback of playing villain on screen
299.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma invited Bollywood villains, Ashish Vidyarthi, Mukesh Rishi, Yashpal Sharma and Abhimanyu Singh to his upcoming episode of 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. During a conversation, Kapil asked Yashpal if he faced any drawbacks of playing a villain on-screen. Yashpal jokingly replied, "The setback is...girls don't come close to me while clicking photos. They stand at a distance."

300.title: Workers’ union asks Hyderabad airport to set up shelter for drivers
300.article_body: Telangana Gig and Platforms Workers Union (TGPWU) has requested the Hyderabad airport authority to set up a shelter for taxi drivers amid soaring temperatures. The TGPWU also appealed for a drinking water facility and subsidised canteen facilities for drivers. "The drivers who have to wait long hours for passengers...are risking their lives for making a living," TGPWU said.

301.title: COVID-19 boosters are essential, we shouldn't delay: Shaw to Health Minister
301.article_body: Biocon Limited's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted to Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Sunday and said that announcing booster shots of COVID-19 vaccines can help prevent the wastage of unused stocks. "All healthcare institutions are worried about unused stocks of vaccines that will expire soon," she said, adding that COVID-19 "boosters are essential and we should not delay".

302.title: Windshield of plane with 198 passengers cracks mid-flight in US, pic surfaces
302.article_body: A Delta Airlines flight made an emergency landing in US' Denver after its cockpit window "spontaneously" cracked while it was around 30,000 feet in the air. One of the 198 passengers on board the flight shared a picture of the cracked windshield, saying, "Fortunately, we landed safely and are about to get back in air. We're grateful for safe flights."

303.title: Haven't heard anything about it: Randhir Kapoor on reports of Ranbir & Alia's wedding
303.article_body: Amid media reports of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt’s wedding in April, Ranbir's uncle Randhir Kapoor remarked that he hasn't heard anything about it. He said, "If such a big wedding was happening at our house, somebody would have surely called me up and informed me." Meanwhile, celebrity mehandi artist Veena Nagda also said she hasn’t been contacted as yet.

304.title: I expect Jadeja to strategise better, we want to see what he can do: Ojha
304.article_body: Former India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said he expects CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja to strategise better in their upcoming games in the IPL season. "It was the same team that won last year...They'll have to come up with different thinking...we want to see what Jadeja can do as captain," he added. CSK have lost their first two games this season.

305.title: Who are we to condemn? Denzel Washington on Will slapping Chris
305.article_body: Actor Denzel Washington has reacted to Will Smith slapping Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars, saying, "Who are we to condemn?" He further said, "I don't know all the ins and outs of the situation but I know the only solution was prayer." Denzel was seen consoling Will after the incident at the ceremony and also spoke to his publicist.

306.title: Reports say Kanye West is 'going away to get help', rapper's team denies
306.article_body: After reports said rapper Kanye West will "go away somewhere to get help", the rapper's team has denied it. West's rep said, "Most [headlines] are being fed to media by...sources close to the Kardashians...which have been...creating false narrative...that not only is untrue...but further compromises his goal of creating...healthy environment for...children he shares...with Kim."

307.title: Video shows Mumbai Police's Khaki Studio performing at 'Sunday Streets'
307.article_body: A video shows the Khaki Studio of the Mumbai Police giving a live performance during the 'Sunday Streets' event on Mumbai roads. The initiative, which was launched last Sunday, is being organised in nine locations from today. Last Sunday saw a huge gathering of people as they engaged in activities like cycling, yoga and running.

308.title: Shein planning to raise funds at a valuation of $100 billion: Report
308.article_body: Chinese fashion e-commerce startup Shein is planning to raise funds at a valuation of about $100 billion, Bloomberg reported on Sunday. The company is in talks with potential investors to raise about $1 billion, the report said. Backed by Sequoia Capital China, IDG Capital and Tiger Global, Shein denied plans to launch an initial public offering (IPO) last month.

309.title: Raj stays underground for 3-4 months, lacks consistency: Pawar
309.article_body: After MNS chief Raj Thackeray alleged that the NCP plays the caste card to "divide" people, the latter party's chief Sharad Pawar said that Thackeray should have "studied" NCP's history before making the remarks. Thackeray "stays underground for three to four months and suddenly surfaces to give a lecture" and never has a consistent stand on any issue, he added.

310.title: Greece minister leads humanitarian aid mission to Ukraine's Odessa
310.article_body: Greek Foreign Minister Nikos Dendias will land in Ukraine's Odessa on Sunday to lead a humanitarian aid mission in the city amid Russia's ongoing invasion of the country. Dendias will carry humanitarian aid which will be handed to the city's municipal authorities. The purpose of Dendias' visit is to also reopen Greece's consulate in the city, its foreign ministry said.

311.title: 68 undertrials in jails for petty crimes released after mega camp in Ludhiana
311.article_body: A mega camp court was organised by the District Legal Services Authority, Ludhiana on Saturday. During the camp, around 68 undertrials, who had been booked and jailed for petty offences, were released by officials. During the camp, the cases of undertrials in custody for petty offences, who were willing to confess to their crimes and plead guilty, were taken up.

312.title: 5 Bajrang Dal workers held for attacking K'taka halal meat seller
312.article_body: Five Bajrang Dal workers have been arrested in Karnataka's Shivamogga after they allegedly attacked a Muslim halal meat seller. This comes amid a campaign by Hindu right-wings to boycott halal products. The group, including the accused, had gone to the seller's shop on Wednesday and asked for non-halal meat. The group reportedly attacked after seller's relative asked them to leave.

313.title: PBKS skipper Mayank hasn't scored a lot so far in IPL 2022: Aakash
313.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra, speaking about Punjab Kings captain Mayank Agarwal, opined that he has not scored many runs in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Mayank is the captain and is a solid player...He hasn't scored a lot so far, but you expect runs from him," Aakash stated. In IPL 2022, Mayank has scored 33 runs in two matches.

314.title: Punjab should first give Hindi-speaking areas to Haryana: Khattar
314.article_body: After the Punjab Assembly sought the transfer of Chandigarh to the state, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar asked the newly-formed AAP government to first hand over the Hindi-speaking areas to his state. "Rajiv-Longowal Accord was signed 35-36 years ago, as per which [Chandigarh] is the capital of both Haryana and Punjab," said Khattar.

315.title: 3-metre ring, other objects found in Maha after mysterious lights in sky, pics surface
315.article_body: A three-metre ring and other objects were found in Maharashtra after mysterious lights were spotted in sky on Saturday night. Experts speculate that the object seen falling from the sky is a satellite that got destroyed after coming into contact with the earth's atmosphere. Earlier, people speculated it could be a meteor shower. Police are working to ascertain the details.

316.title: Netflix halts development of Will Smith's film over Oscars slap: Report
316.article_body: Netflix has halted the production of Will Smith's action-thriller movie, 'Fast and Loose', following the Oscars incident with Chris Rock, according to The Hollywood Reporter. Smith had slapped the Oscars presenter and comedian Chris for making a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett's condition during the award ceremony. Smith later apologised to Chris Rock and resigned from the Oscars Academy.

317.title: Peace? I hate the word: World's richest person Elon Musk
317.article_body: The world's richest person, Elon Musk, on Sunday tweeted, "Peace. Peace? I hate the word. Those who do care about peace (myself aspirationally included) don't need to hear it...And those who don't care about peace? Well..." In an earlier tweet, he wrote, "They wrote PEACE on the wall at Berghain! I refused (to) enter." Berghain is a nightclub in Berlin.

318.title: Govt violated Constitution, will not leave Parliament: Pak Opposition on no-trust motion
318.article_body: Pakistan Peoples Party Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari has said Pakistan government has violated Constitution by not allowing voting on no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan. He said, "The united opposition is not leaving Parliament. Our lawyers are on their way to Supreme Court." He added, "We call on all institutions to protect, uphold, defend and implement the Constitution of Pakistan."

319.title: There won't be any talks of terrorists in madrasas: UP Minister
319.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister Dharam Pal Singh said that the students will be given education in madrasas based on new National Education Policy. "Nationalism will be taught to students in madrasas of the state. There will be no talks of terrorists," he added. Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai's political secretary had earlier said madrasas propagate instigation to innocent kids.

320.title: Saudi minister meets SRK, Salman, Saif and Akshay Kumar in Mumbai, shares pics
320.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Minister of Culture Bader bin Farhan Alsaud met Bollywood actors Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, Saif Ali Khan and Akshay Kumar during his Mumbai visit. "Delighted to have engaged in insightful conversations on the beautiful world of films, exploring cross-cultural collaborations [with them]," he wrote on Instagram, while sharing pictures.

321.title: Mizoram bans import of pigs, pork products amid African Swine Fever outbreak
321.article_body: The Mizoram government has banned the import of pigs and pork products until further orders after fresh African Swine Fever (ASF) cases were reported in the state, according to an official notification. The department has been directed to ensure safe disposal of pig carcasses. As many as 384 pig deaths were reported from across five districts of Mizoram, officials said.

322.title: Look at how Dhoni is batting, he's not finished, he's a finisher: Kaif
322.article_body: Ahead of CSK's match against PBKS, former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif praised CSK batter MS Dhoni for his performance in their first two games in IPL 2022. "Dhoni is not finished, he's a finisher. People have said his time is over...this could be his last IPL, but look at how he has batted, remaining not-out in both innings," stated Kaif.

323.title: Very impressed with Hardik Pandya's captaincy: Jaffer
323.article_body: Ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer has said he was "very impressed" with Hardik Pandya's captaincy as GT defeated DC by 14 runs to win their second game in a row. "By the end of the 15th over, Hardik had four overs of their specialist bowlers...Although he had to manage one over, I think...he trusted his main bowlers," stated Jaffer.

324.title: Pak Prez dissolves National Assembly on PM Imran Khan's advice
324.article_body: Pakistan President Arif Alvi on Sunday dissolved the country's National Assembly on the advice of Prime Minister Imran Khan to make way for fresh elections. "There should be elections in a democratic way. I call upon the people of Pakistan to prepare for elections," said Khan. Earlier, the Assembly Deputy Speaker rejected the no-confidence motion against Khan.

325.title: US Prez mistakenly refers to Michelle Obama as Vice President, video viral
325.article_body: US President Joe Biden in his recent speech mistakenly referred to former First Lady Michelle Obama as the former Vice President. Biden while praising First Lady Jill Biden said, "And I’m deeply proud of the work she is doing as First Lady with Joining Forces initiative she started with Michelle Obama when she was Vice President and now carries on."

326.title: It shall pass: Shilpa as Badshah says 'you've faced difficulties with a smile'
326.article_body: Rapper Badshah praised actress Shilpa Shetty and said she manages to remain strong despite all odds. While speaking to Shilpa on her fitness show, 'Shape of You', Badshah said, "After all that you've gone through, you manage to put up...a smile on your face and you don't fake it." Replying to this, Shilpa said, "Nothing is permanent...This too shall pass."

327.title: 3 held in Bihar for cheating Vaishno Devi pilgrims with fake chopper tickets
327.article_body: Three people were arrested from Bihar's Khagaria by the Jammu police for allegedly cheating people by providing fake tickets for helicopter rides from Katra to Mata Vaishno Devi shrine atop the hill nearby, police said on Saturday. Meanwhile, the Vaishno Devi Shrine Board said it has not authorised any private travel agency for helicopter bookings for Katra-Sanjichhat-Katra.

328.title: Arjun Rampal, Purab to star in investigative thriller series 'London Files'
328.article_body: Actors Arjun Rampal and Purab Kohli will be seen in an investigative thriller series, 'London Files'. The six-episode series has been directed by Sachin Pathak, the filmmaker behind shows like 'Kathmandu Connection' and 'A Simple Murder'. In addition to Arjun and Purab, 'London Files' will also feature Sapna Pabbi, Medha Rana, Gopal Datt and Eva Jane Willis in key roles.

329.title: Disapprove of policemen taking anyone's phone: B'luru police chief
329.article_body: Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Saturday shared a news report stating that police officers were "forcing" locals in the city to hand over their phones to check WhatsApp and photos, saying, "We strongly disapprove of any such act." He urged people to share the details of such incidents. "Strict action shall be taken against such officers," he added.

330.title: Anti-Romeo squads back in UP; to be active near schools, colleges
330.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has activated the anti-Romeo squads again in a bid to provide safety to women. According to Additional Chief Secretary Navneet Sehgal, the fortnight-long drive will continue till April 15. "Anti-Romeo squads will be activated near schools and colleges," said Sehgal. "In the evening, police will undertake patrolling in busy markets and crowded places," he added.

331.title: Imran Khan's ex-wife calls him 'mini-Trump', asks Twitter to take action on his tweet
331.article_body: Ahead of the no-trust motion against Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday, his ex-wife Reham Khan termed him "mini Trump" on Twitter and urged the platform to take action against him. She wrote, "This mini Trump must be restrained from inciting violence." Khan had called his political opponents as "the traitors who sold out to foreign masters" in a tweet.

332.title: Australia defeat England to win Women's World Cup for the 7th time
332.article_body: Australia defeated England by 71 runs in the final in Christchurch to win 2022 Women's World Cup. With this, Australia have now won seven Women's ODI World Cups. Australia put up a total of 356/5, the highest total in a Women's World Cup final. Australia's Alyssa Healy recorded the highest individual score (170 runs) in a Women's World Cup final.

333.title: Pakistan PM Imran Khan asks President to dissolve assemblies, hold fresh elections
333.article_body: After no-trust vote against Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan was rejected by the deputy speaker of the country's National Assembly, Imran said, "I have written to the President to dissolve the assemblies." He added, "There should be elections in a democratic way. I call upon the people of Pakistan to prepare for elections."

334.title: Mumbai’s annual food market, Ramzan Bazar, reopens after 2 years
334.article_body: After the state government lifted all the COVID-19 related curbs this month, Mumbai's annual food market, Ramzan Bazar, is set to reopen after remaining closed for two consecutive years. "This week, I met all the stakeholders, requested for strict hygiene...All the concerned departments will fully cooperate," said local MLA Amin Patel. Notably, Mohammed Ali Road is the market's traditional spot.

335.title: Additional OSCs to open in districts with high crime rate against women: Smriti Irani
335.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani said the Centre is planning to open additional one-stop centres (OSCs) in those districts where the crime rate against women is high. "We request your (states’) support to open these 300 new centres," Irani added. Additionally, government is planning to set up such centres in at least 10 other countries to support women of Indian origin.

336.title: 4 thieves cut open ATM in Gurugram, escape with cash worth ₹13.28 lakh
336.article_body: Four unidentified thieves allegedly cut open an ATM of a private bank in Gurugram and stole cash worth ₹13.28 lakh. Police said preliminary investigation revealed that the accused used a gas cutter to cut open the machine and sprayed the CCTVs with black paint before escaping. "The kiosk shutter was lowered and no security guard was deployed," an inspector said.

337.title: K'taka man throws mother in river, says 'Wife wanted to get rid of her'
337.article_body: A 38-year-old man allegedly killed his 60-year-old mother by throwing her into the Bhima river in Karnataka. The accused, Bheemashankar Yalimeli, during investigation, stated his wife wanted to get rid of his mother as she was ill. He also added he was facing difficulty in arranging money for his mother's treatment and he and his wife often fought over it.

338.title: In a first, SDMC collects over ₹1,000 crore in property tax
338.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation collected ₹1,075 crore from 460,000 taxpayers this year. According to Radha Krishan, head of the SDMC's property tax department, the corporation has crossed the ₹1,000 crore mark for the first time while it collected ₹943 crore in 2020-21. Krishan added that ₹917 crore was raised as property transfer duty which is also an all-time high.

339.title: Pakistan's Punjab Governor fired ahead of no-trust vote against PM
339.article_body: The Governor of Pakistan's Punjab province, Chaudhry Mohammad Sarwar, was fired on Sunday ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan in the National Assembly. According to media reports, Omar Sarfraz Cheema has been appointed as the new Governor of the province. Sarwar was not following the government line, added reports.

340.title: No-trust motion against Pakistan PM Imran Khan rejected
340.article_body: The no-confidence motion against Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan was rejected by Pakistan National Assembly Deputy Speaker Qasim Khan Suri on Sunday. Suri declared the motion as unconstitutional, reported ANI. Though PM Khan is the third premier to face the no-confidence motion, no one in Pakistan's history has ever been ousted through such a motion.

341.title: Pak Opposition moves motion to remove National Assembly Speaker
341.article_body: A Pakistan's Opposition member on Sunday moved a motion seeking the removal of the National Assembly Speaker Asad Qaiser ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan. Over 100 members of Opposition parties have reportedly signed the no-confidence motion against Qaiser. Notably, Section 144 has been imposed in Islamabad amid fears of violence.

342.title: 2 bodies found in Pune dam's backwaters after clothes seen nearby
342.article_body: The bodies of two men in their late 20s were fished out from the backwaters of Khadakwasla Dam, located on the outskirts of Pune, police said on Sunday. The incident came to light after locals informed guards about two pairs of shoes and clothes lying near the dam, while no human activity was seen inside the backwaters, an official said.

343.title: Nortje, Warner likely to play in DC's next game, says Ponting
343.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said it's likely that South Africa pacer Anrich Nortje and Australia batter David Warner will be available for their next game against LSG on April 7. "Nortje bowled 100% in the warm-ups...[and] I think Warner has arrived in Mumbai," stated Ponting. After winning their opening game against MI, DC lost to GT on Saturday.

344.title: I still need to gather courage to post a picture in a bikini: Mrunal
344.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur feels India hasn't normalised different body types. "We still think if you're going to a beach you've to have a perfect body," she added. "It's okay to be bloated...You...[don't] necessarily [need]...six-pack abs," she said. Mrunal said she still needs to gather the courage to post a picture in a bikini and be comfortable in her body type.

345.title: Actor Vikrant Massey gets Gulzar's juttis as birthday gift, shares pic
345.article_body: Actor Vikrant Massey took to Instagram Stories to share that he received lyricist Gulzar's juttis as a birthday gift. He shared a picture of the juttis and a letter from Gulzar's daughter Meghna, who he had worked with in Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Chhapaak'. "Dear Vikrant...This was long overdue...But I am glad I got it done today!" the letter by Meghna read.

346.title: Man who claimed he accidentally kissed woman in Mumbai train gets 1-yr jail term
346.article_body: A 37-year-old man was sentenced to one year of rigorous imprisonment and a fine of ₹10,000 was imposed on him for forcibly kissing a woman on her cheek in a local train in Mumbai in 2015. The man had claimed that he was pushed by fellow commuters, following which he fell on her and his lips accidentally touched her cheeks.

347.title: China sees highest COVID cases since Feb 2020, 1 detected with new subtype of Omicron
347.article_body: China has reported over 13,000 new COVID-19 cases, the highest since the peak of the first wave more than two years ago. State media reported a case infected with a new subtype of the Omicron variant. The new iteration of the virus, isolated from a mild COVID-19 patient, evolved from the BA.1.1 branch of the Omicron variant, Global Times reported.

348.title: On-duty police officer falls after bull hits him in Delhi, video surfaces
348.article_body: In a CCTV footage that has surfaced online, a bull can be seen pushing an on-duty police officer on a road in Delhi. The police officer, Gyaan Singh, can be seen falling to the ground after the animal pushes him. Reports said that after the incident, the constable was taken to the hospital and has now been discharged.

349.title: I get uncomfortable when somebody calls me an OTT star: Rohit Saraf
349.article_body: Rohit Saraf in an interview said, "It makes me uncomfortable when somebody calls me...OTT star." "Because I feel...you're putting me in a box that I'm not willing to be in," he added. "I don't want to label myself an...OTT actor or...film actor. If there's...a street play, and I think it's...something from which I can learn, I'll do it," Rohit said.

350.title: I can't hit such shots even if I start batting again: Aakash on Buttler's 100(68)
350.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has praised RR batter Jos Buttler for his 100 of 68 balls against MI, stating that it "gladdens the heart" to see the 31-year-old bat.
