"From a batter's point of view, I will not be able to hit such shots even if I start batting again," Aakash added. RR defeated MI by 23 runs in the match.

351.title: 15 Thane school students fall sick due to suspected food poisoning; 4 hospitalised
351.article_body: Around 15 students of an ashram school in Thane's Bhiwandi started vomiting and suffered from diarrhoea after consuming regular meals at the ashram, officials said. While 11 were discharged after primary treatment, four were admitted to the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Hospital in Kalwa. The ashram's general secretary claimed the students suffered from dehydration and not food poisoning.

352.title: You taught me so much: Abhishek shares old pic with Ajay on his b'day
352.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram on Saturday to wish Ajay Devgn on his birthday. He shared an old picture with Ajay from the set of the 1998 film 'Major Saab', and wrote, "Happy birthday AJ. A photo from...shoot of 'Major Saab'. My first job as a production boy. I knew nothing about a...set and you taught me so much."

353.title: Actress Estelle Harris, voice of Mrs Potato Head in Toy Story films, dies at 93
353.article_body: Veteran American actress Estelle Harris, who voiced the character of Mrs Potato Head in Pixar's 'Toy Story' franchise, has passed away at the age of 93. She died on Saturday at her residence in Palm Desert, California, of natural causes, her son Glen Harris told The Hollywood Reporter. Estelle was also known for her role in the sitcom 'Seinfeld'.

354.title: Ukraine would not have been invaded if I was in White House: Trump
354.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump claimed during a rally that Ukraine's invasion by Russian President Vladimir Putin would never have happened if he was in White House. He also said that when people say he knows Putin it's a "good thing, not a bad thing". Earlier, Trump had said, "The problem isn't that Putin is smart...but...that our leaders are dumb."

355.title: UP man dies as bullet accidentally hits face while fiddling with pistol
355.article_body: A 35-year-old jeweller, Rahul Verma, from Uttar Pradesh died after he accidentally fired from his own licensed pistol. His father said that he was fiddling with the pistol when it accidentally fired. Reports said that a bullet hit Rahul's face. Rahul was rushed to Ram Manohar Lohia hospital where he was declared brought dead.

356.title: Man saved from falling off dilapidated house during AAP roadshow in Guj
356.article_body: A group of men reportedly saved a man from falling off the roof of a multi-story structure in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The incident took place during the road show of the Aam Aadmi Party. Reports said that the people who were accompanying AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann also asked people inside the building to evacuate it.

357.title: Security deployed, Section 144 imposed in Islamabad ahead of no-trust vote against Pak PM
357.article_body: The security has been tightened and Section 144 imposed in Pakistan's Islamabad ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan, which is set to take place in Parliament on Sunday. The administration has ordered a ban on pillion riders across the city. Earlier, Khan had urged people to take to the streets ahead of the motion.

358.title: BJP's poll wins give license to govt to loot people: Randeep Surjewala
358.article_body: Electoral victories for BJP have become a licence for the government to "loot" the people, Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said. "The diktat of the cruel, cumbersome and back-breaking price rise imposed by the PM Modi-led government with effect from April 1 has shattered the budget of every household in India," Surjewala added.

359.title: Marriage bureau penalised, told to refund fees for failing to find suitable match
359.article_body: The District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has penalised a marriage bureau in Chandigarh and directed it to refund the complainants' fee after it failed to find a suitable match. The commission observed that the company had exhibited a "negligent and careless attitude". The men whose profiles were shared were "overaged, bald, fat or weren't of desired caste", the commission added.

360.title: Won't condone social media block, useless due to VPN: Sri Lanka min
360.article_body: Sri Lankan Youth and Sports Minister Namal Rajapaksa on Sunday tweeted that he'll never condone the blocking of social media platforms in the country. This comes after the country blocked social media platforms over reports of protests being planned amid an economic crisis. "The availability of VPN, just like I'm using now, makes such bans completely useless," he said.

361.title: Karauli incident could’ve been avoided if administration was vigilant: Ex-Raj CM
361.article_body: Former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje condemned the stone-pelting incident in Karauli and said it could have been avoided if the administration was vigilant. Communal clashes broke out in Karauli on Saturday, injuring nearly 25 persons. "Hate mentality cannot be allowed to flourish in peace-loving Rajasthan. The administration should take strict action against the culprits," Raje added.

362.title: Algerian man held at Guantanamo Bay for 20 years by US released
362.article_body: The US has released an Algerian man, Sufiyan Barhoumi, imprisoned at the Guantanamo Bay detention centre for about 20 years. Barhoumi, who was captured in Pakistan and sent to Guantanamo in 2002, has been repatriated to his home country, said the Department of Defense. The release comes after the authorities determined he was not a member of Al-Qaeda or Taliban.

363.title: Was contacted by AAP but won't leave Congress: TS Singh Deo
363.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has claimed that he was "contacted" by AAP but asserted that he "won't leave" Congress. "Five generations of my family have been in Congress... (Can't) think beyond Congress," Deo said. "I've not met Arvind Kejriwal but it's true... there are people who contact each other. So, it's not like nobody contacted me," he added.

364.title: Man killed by in-laws for getting married third time in Jharkhand
364.article_body: A 35-year-old man was killed allegedly by his in-laws for getting married for the third time in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district. According to the police, the skeleton of the deceased, Ladu Haiburu, was inside a well located in a Naxalism-hit area. Haiburu had a fight with his brother-in-law from an earlier marriage and went missing on March 16, police said.

365.title: Ex-Pak PM Nawaz Sharif attacked in London, daughter calls for Imran Khan's arrest
365.article_body: Former Pakistani PM Nawaz Sharif was allegedly attacked in London by an activist of PM Imran Khan's PTI party. This comes after Khan said if Sharif's brother, Shehbaz Sharif, takes over then they will do slavery of America. Sharif's daughter, Maryam Nawaz Sharif, called for the arrest of PM Khan, saying he should be booked for "provocation, incitement and sedition".

366.title: Suhana, Khushi to shoot for 40 days in Ooty for Zoya's The Archies: Report
366.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan, Boney Kapoor's daughter Khushi Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda will reportedly shoot for Zoya Akhtar's upcoming project 'The Archies' in Ooty for the next 40 days with a local crew. Earlier, Suhana, Khushi and Agastya's photos from sets of the Archies adaptation had also gone viral on social media.

367.title: Woman was moved by 'The Kashmir...', wanted to feed us with her hands: Producer
367.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal said that while shooting the film, a local woman would bring food for the team. "It was not just for a couple of us, but it was for the entire crew. She was so moved that we were making this film, she wanted to feed us with her hands to express that," he said.

368.title: US agency confirms damage to 112 million years old dinosaur tracks
368.article_body: US' Bureau of Land Management has confirmed minor damages to the dinosaur tracks at Utah's Mill Canyon, which is about 112 million years old, due to machinery used for construction work there. This comes after a palaeontological assessment of the tracks. The agency said that it will follow the assessment's recommendations, seek public input and work with the palaeontology community.

369.title: I would love to but I think he's very busy: John on reuniting with Akshay
369.article_body: John Abraham has said he'd love to work with Akshay Kumar again. "I love Akshay...when we talk about two heroes...who...look good on screen together, it's Akshay and me," John said, adding, "But I think he's very busy...he's doing probably 144 films now? But I'm going to...work with him soon." They've worked together in films like 'Garam Masala' and 'Desi Boyz'.

370.title: 14 killed in floods, mudslides due to heavy rainfall in Brazil
370.article_body: At least 14 people were killed after heavy rainfall triggered floods and mudslides in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro state, said authorities. Cars were reportedly swept off as the streets in the coastal towns and cities were flooded. The authorities said that emergency rescue teams moved around 144 people to safety in the affected areas.

371.title: Enjoying my time with GT, two wins in two games, so far so good: Rashid Khan
371.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan has said he's enjoying his time with the franchise and trying to contribute as much as possible. On his bowling against DC, Rashid said, "[In] first over, I tried different grips to see which one is the right one on this wicket." So far, Rashid has picked a wicket each in their two games.

372.title: 50 tonnes of wood gutted as fire breaks out at godown in Gujarat, none injured
372.article_body: Over 50 tonnes of firewood were gutted after a fire broke out at a godown in a four-storey building in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. "Prima facie, it appears that welding work was going on in the building when the fire started due to the presence of thinner liquid," a fire official said. It took firefighters over five hours to douse the fire.

373.title: Couple spotted kissing in stands during DC-GT IPL 2022 match, pic goes viral
373.article_body: A couple was spotted kissing in the stands during IPL 2022 match between DC and GT. Reacting to the viral picture, a fan tweeted, "This couple took the IPL match to next level." "Kiss cam in IPL?" another fan wrote. Other tweets read, "IPL is truly going global" and "*Me starts watching IPL with my family*....That one couple: [kisses]."

374.title: Australia record the highest total in a final in Women's World Cup history
374.article_body: Australia put up a total of 356/5 against England in the 2022 Women's World Cup final, breaking the record for the highest total in a final in Women's World Cup history. The previous highest total in a Women's World Cup final was 259/7, registered by Australia in the 2013 edition against West Indies.

375.title: 9 NHAI officials among 22 booked by CBI for corruption in highway projects
375.article_body: Nine officials of NHAI and five companies are among 22 accused booked by the CBI for alleged corruption in the execution and operation of three highway projects. The NHAI officials, including three general manager-level officers, took a monthly bribe to the tune of ₹1-2 lakh from the accused companies, the CBI alleged. The offence took place between 2008 and 2010.

376.title: AAP creates atmosphere via media, nothing on ground: Anurag Thakur
376.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has alleged that AAP creates "an atmosphere via media" but has "nothing on the ground". "He (Arvind Kejriwal) couldn't win a seat in UP, did you see his condition in Uttarakhand, Goa?" Thakur asked the press in Chandigarh. He further said that BJP gets votes "unilaterally" in PM Narendra Modi's name wherever there are elections.

377.title: Ex-Odisha MLA Anup Sai sentenced to life for killing live-in partner, her daughter
377.article_body: Former Odisha MLA and Biju Janata Dal leader Anup Sai has been sentenced to life imprisonment by a Chhattisgarh court on charges of murdering his live-in partner and her daughter in 2016. Police claimed Sai conspired to kill her when she insisted on marriage and demanded a share in his property. Sai's driver, another accused in the case, was acquitted.

378.title: I may not accept result of no-confidence vote: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
378.article_body: Ahead of the vote on the no-confidence motion against him on Sunday, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said he had "more than one plan" in place and may not accept the move to oust him. Khan urged the country's youth to stage "peaceful protests" against a "foreign conspiracy" allegedly hatched against his government, while asking them not to criticise the Army.

379.title: Dad convinced his doctor that he needed 2 drinks at night to sleep: Ranbir
379.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed his father, late actor Rishi Kapoor had the habit of having two drinks every night. Ranbir added that during the early stages of his cancer treatment in the US, he was worried about this routine being disrupted. "He tricked his doctor claiming...he wasn't able to sleep at night and as...remedy, he'd chug down two drinks," Ranbir said.

380.title: Can't deny adoption rights just because man is Muslim: Delhi court
380.article_body: A court in Delhi has granted custody parole to a Muslim prisoner so as to allow him to go sign adoption papers in Haryana. The court observed that the man can't be denied adoption rights just because he's a Muslim. The prosecution had opposed the parole claiming that Muslims can't adopt a child as it's not legally permissible in Islam.

381.title: It's my personal life and I don't like to discuss it: Taapsee on marriage plans
381.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, when asked about marriage plans, said she does not like to discuss her personal life. She also joked about wearing three rings. "In that case, I should be engaged to three people," Taapsee added. She further said she eats in accordance with weather. "Wherever I go...I tell the hotel staff...about my meals...they serve me accordingly," she added.

382.title: Malaika Arora to be discharged from hospital today after car accident
382.article_body: Malaika Arora, who was admitted to Apollo Hospital in Navi Mumbai after receiving some minor injuries in a car accident on Saturday, will be discharged from the hospital today. "Malaika has minor injuries on forehead, CT scan has turned out fine and she's currently okay," the hospital said on Saturday. The accident took place when Malaika was returning from Pune.

383.title: PNB branch in Ghaziabad robbed at gunpoint; 4 flee with ₹11 lakh
383.article_body: A Punjab National Bank branch in Ghaziabad was robbed at gunpoint by four men on Saturday, said police. The perpetrators, dressed in black and wearing red masks, fled with ₹11 lakh cash. "They held the staff inside the bank (at gunpoint) and fled with the money. We are ascertaining more information through CCTV footage to identify the accused," said police.

384.title: Drug addict kills sister after argument over domestic issues in Delhi
384.article_body: A drug addict murdered his 24-year-old sister in Delhi. He killed his sister after an argument over domestic issues reportedly broke out between them. Reports said that strangulation marks were found on the victim's neck. The accused confessed to killing his sister during investigation by the police. He also said that both of them were drug addicts.

385.title: Jadeja is under pressure, CSK openers need to perform: Shastri
385.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja is under pressure after suffering consecutive defeats in their two games in the ongoing IPL season. "There's a new captain at the helm, and he's under pressure. Yes, Dhoni is in form but if one of those openers doesn't score then CSK will find it difficult," stated Shastri.

386.title: Domino’s offers free assured surprise gifts worth ₹50 crore
386.article_body: Domino's has announced that it is throwing a birthday party where it's offering surprise gifts with every order. Gifts worth ₹50 crore will be given to customers, it revealed. The free assured surprise gifts can be availed by customers on delivery, dine-in, and takeaway orders via the Domino's app or at their stores.

387.title: Growing trust in India is helping in key deals: Piyush Goyal
387.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's decisions have been able to generate a lot of goodwill for India globally, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. His statement comes as India and Australia signed the Economic Cooperation and Trade Agreement to boost economic ties. On being asked what is facilitating these trade deals, Goyal said, "Growing trust in India is helping in all such developments."

388.title: Pravin Tambe breaks down after watching his biopic with KKR team, video surfaces
388.article_body: Leg-spinner Pravin Tambe, who made his IPL debut aged 41, broke down after he watched the biopic on his life along with the KKR team. The movie 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' was released on Friday and stars Shreyas Talpade. KKR shared a video on Twitter showing Tambe breaking down. "Just never give up on your dreams...Dreams do come true," he said.

389.title: India reports 1,096 new COVID-19 cases, 81 deaths in last 24 hours
389.article_body: India has reported 1,096 new COVID-19 cases and 81 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,260 cases and 83 deaths. Out of the 81 deaths reported today, 16 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 65 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

390.title: Australia's Alyssa Healy records highest-ever score in a World Cup final
390.article_body: Australia opener Alyssa Healy has recorded the highest-ever score in a World Cup final across men's and women's cricket. The 32-year-old scored 170(138) against England in the 2022 Women's World Cup final today. She broke the previous record set by former Australian men's wicketkeeper-batter Adam Gilchrist, who had scored 149(104) against Sri Lanka in the 2007 World Cup final.

391.title: Remove mosque loudspeakers or will play Hanuman Chalisa there: Raj
391.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Saturday demanded that the Maharashtra government should remove loudspeakers at mosques and said that if this isn't done then loudspeakers will be placed outside mosques and "Hanuman Chalisa will be played at higher volume". "I'm not against prayers, you can pray at...home," he added. Moreover, he demanded that MP and MLA pensions should be stopped.

392.title: Drug trafficker sentenced to 14 yrs in prison by Bahraich court
392.article_body: A Nepal-based drug trafficker, who was arrested by NCB nearly five years ago, was sentenced to 14 years of rigorous imprisonment by a local court in Bahraich, NCB officials said. The court has imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on him and in case of non-payment of the fine, he will have to remain in prison for two more years.

393.title: Ghaziabad reverses order banning meat sale during Navratri
393.article_body: A day after imposing a ban on sale of raw meat during Navratri from April 2 to 10, the Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam reversed the order. In a fresh notification issued on Saturday, the mayor said the regulations by the state government would be followed. The officials said that no such ban has been ordered by the UP government so far.

394.title: Wearing mask is always safer: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray
394.article_body: On the first day of the removal of COVID-19 restrictions in Maharashtra, state Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday urged people to follow the mask advisory. "Wearing a mask is always safer, don’t feel awkward wearing one for your own safety," Aaditya said. Recently, the Maharashtra government announced that wearing masks is no longer compulsory in the state.

395.title: Chandigarh allows restaurants, bars and hotels to stay open till 3 am
395.article_body: Under Chandigarh's new excise policy, restaurants, bars and hotels in the Union Territory can remain open till 3 am. "The facility of two-hour extension in closure timings [will be] given to restaurants, bars and hotels on payment of additional license fees," an official release stated. Low-alcoholic drinks, including beer and wine, have been exempted from license fees and taxes.

396.title: How can he die suddenly?: Maharashtra minister on Aryan Khan drug case witness
396.article_body: The death of Prabhakar Sail, an independent witness in the drugs-on-cruise case involving Aryan Khan, will be investigated by Maharashtra Police, said the state Home Minister, Dilip Walse Patil. He said people were wondering how "such a strong man could die of a heart attack so suddenly". The minister asked the Director General of Police to investigate Sail's death.

397.title: Broadway's Macbeth performances cancelled after Craig tests COVID +ve
397.article_body: Two performances of Macbeth on Broadway have been cancelled after Daniel Craig tested positive for COVID-19, a statement on the production's official Twitter account read. "We apologise for the inconvenience this causes ticket holders, but the safety of our audiences, the cast and crew remains our top priority," it added. The 54-year-old actor stars in the play opposite Ruth Negga.

398.title: Suspecting wife's extramarital affair, Hyd man kills minor daughter, self
398.article_body: A 40-year-old man died by suicide after killing his six-year-old daughter in Hyderabad. Reports said that the man suspected his wife of having an extramarital affair. The man had checked into a lodge with his daughter where he killed her and later died by suicide. His wife had expressed desire to move to Canada for her career after leaving job.

399.title: Did 'chhichhora' roles before Beta; cried when I was offered the film: Aruna
399.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani, who played Anil Kapoor's on-screen mother, Lakshmi Devi, in 'Beta' recalled that it was difficult for her to bag the role in the film even though it was helmed by her brother, Indra Kumar. Aruna added that she cried a lot after she bagged the role. "Before 'Beta', I used to do only chhichhora roles," she said.

400.title: GT's total was not so big, we could've batted better: Pant after defeat
400.article_body: After their 14-run defeat, DC captain Rishabh Pant said GT's 171-run total was not "so big" and they could've batted batter in the game. "[During] the powerplay, we lost three wickets, then in the middle overs we lost three wickets...every match is going to be hard to come back after losing so many wickets," he stated. Pant scored 43(29).

401.title: 16-yr-old booked for filming home tutor in bathroom in Pune
401.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in Pune has been booked for recording videos of his English home tutor while she was in the bathroom. The boy was arrested and sent to the District Women and Child Welfare Committee for counselling. "He had developed isolation symptoms during the lockdown period which had a significant impact on his mental state," said police.

402.title: Man, 5-yr-old son accidentally locked up at bank in Punjab; rescued
402.article_body: A man and his five-year-old son who had gotten accidentally locked up at a bank in Punjab's Ludhiana on Saturday were rescued after about two and a half hours. The father-son duo had come to the bank to deposit some cash. The man claimed he'd called out to the officials when they were pulling down the shutter, but was "ignored".

403.title: 20-yr-old youth arrested for killing his mother's 47-yr-old lover in Mumbai
403.article_body: A 20-year-old youth has been arrested in Mumbai for allegedly killing his mother's 47-year-old lover, police said. The incident took place when the accused reached home and found the victim and his mother together. Police added that an argument took place between them and in a fit of rage the youth took a kitchen knife and stabbed the victim.
